note.p: Education: In London, under Dr James at greenwich and at Mr boucher's 'respectable seminary' at Paddington

Career: Entered Royal Navy as Midshipman (23 February 1778), rising to ranks of Post Captain, (18 June 1795); Commodore (1809); Rear Admiral of the Blue (4 June 1814); Rear Admiral of he White, (12 August 1819); Rear Admiral of the Red (19 July 1821); Vice Admiral o the Blue (27 May 1825); Vice Admiral of the White (22Juoy 1830)
Freemason, initiated 1818, Grand Master's Lodge No 1
Library and Museum of Freemasonry, 'Freemasons and the Royal Society: Alphabetical List of Fellows of the Royal Society who were Freemasons' 2010 page 13
